area_name: Moonstone, Leg Lock Rock, Bolt Rock Area

content.description: Sloppy moves that start low on climbers right. Move left and around the corner, toping out on "Flying Fish".
content.location: The boulder located on climbers left of "Moonstone"

content.description: High-steppy moves on rounded knobs with a high crux and less-than-positive topout. The arete is off for the V3, using it drops the grade to around V1 but the problem is almost as fun.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spot, it would not be fun to blow the topout and skid down this one.
content.location: On Bolt Rock, right of the Bolt Arete. Climbs up the face with obvious cool knobs.

content.description:
New Moon is not Eclipse. It is the link up of starting on Eclipse and finishing on Moonstone. The crux comes in the form of a gigantic span between your foot and hand from the eclipse crimp rail to the left most low hold on moonstone with your foot on the start of Eclipse.  

  This can be done statically, but for most people under 5'11" you'll have to jump making this a bit harder of a problem.

Steep! Sit-down start at the obvious jug underneath the boulder on the right side, near the edge of the drop.  Steep but positive pulls out the overhang until your feet cut loose, then a dynamic move up to a crescent incut near the lip.  Slap the dish over the lip and then don't come off the finishing jugs and you are there. 

  One of the best problems Groom has to offer.
content.protection: Clean fall on flat hardpack dirt.
content.location: Half-way between Leglock Rock and the Wave, facing Leglock Rock.

content.description:
Moonlighting is the much overlooked cave problem right below moonstone and to the right of starting full moon. 

  You'll see the small cave that makes you start horizontal and upside down in batshit. Small edges and a pinch, with a super hard sloper slap and campus is the programming here.
content.location: Below Moonstone, the only cave in sight.

content.description:
Lob Job is on the scoopy part of Leg Lock Rock in between the Baseball Throw on the left and Charles in Charge on the right.

 As I remember this was a really independent line. At least the way I did it. I found the movement to be subtle, powerful, tenuous, and slopey! Go straight up without using any holds on either of it's neighbors and see what you think.
content.protection: Pad, easily worked on by yourself.
content.location: In between the Baseball Throw, and Charles In Charge, Leg Lock Rock.

content.description: Kind of beta intensive involving crossovers, body tension, and, well, you'll see.
content.location: Right of Charles in Charge. Finishes on same bucket.

content.description:
Full Moon is the Extension of Moonstone. Start below Moonstone right where you walk up to it. Start both hands on a jug, heel-hook and traverse left into Moonstone finishing as you would on the classic. 

  The extension adds about 8 more hand moves, making this an awesome endurance fest of a problem ranging in between 17-20 moves. Must do for locals who are running out of options or the endurance master.
content.protection: a few pads, once you understand the beginning you only need a pad a the crux of moonstone.

content.description: Find the clean cut face of Flying Fish. On the left side of the face you'll find an undercling and slightly higher than head height left hand thin pinch, pull onto the boulder from the pinch and the undercling and jump to the lip, traverse the lip right all the way across the boulder and top out....Super fun jug traverse on the lip.
content.location: Flying Fish Boulder-Faces Charles in Charge.

content.description:
Flying Fish has long been a classic run and jump problem in the middle of the clean face of The Fish Boulder. 

  It also goes as a regular problem, but it's the grade that does the jumping!!
content.location: Center of clean face on The Fish Boulder

content.description: Super tech slopers on the undercut arête, SE corner. Tough for the grade till you figure it out. Will this be the one that gets away? This problem is in between Flyin Fish and Undertoe V5 which climbs the slanting edge of the boulder to the right of Fish Tale also topping out on Fish Tale.
content.protection: Pads, trees may have grown over this thing?
content.location: The Fish Boulder is right next to Leg Lock and Moonstone.

content.description: Fierce Invalids climbs up the perched, tear drop shaped boulder that forms the tunnel as you approach the back porch area. The problem faces the One Hand Slap boulder, and begins at the edge of a drop off into the trail below. Luckily, the only features on this east face are two xenoliths that lead you away from the precipice. Start on the inset, basketball-shaped xenolith and make a long move up and left to an inset, football shaped xenolith. Match and punch it to the top for an easy top out.
content.protection: Some pads for the rock ledge below the problem. Don't fall to the right....that would suck.
content.location: East face of the perched tear drop boulder in the center of the main area.

content.description: A reachy problem, this is the "intro" to Leg-Lock rock.  Start with a right undercling and a left sidepull, and then work your way up to the large knob at the top of the boulder.
content.protection: A clean flat landing.  Spotters welcome!
content.location: On the left "corner" of Leg-Lock rock, to the left of Charles in Charge.  Moonstone faces it.  Descend via the tree to the right of Charles or downclimb off the back left "corner."

content.description: Just left of the classic Moonstone. Fantastic moves! Start practically lying down with a good flake for the left hand, a crimp for the right, and a left heel hook; make hard moves to a left undercling with thumb catch, then fall into a right sidepull and throw to the lip. The original line here was Leapfrog (V1) which started on the lip by stepping off the boulder behind.
content.location: On the Moonstone Boulder just left of the Moonstone.

content.description:
A great problem with distinctive moves.  Start with undercling and a toe-cam (if tall enough) and make the long reach to unlikely slopers.  Keep your feet on and toss for the jug. 

Please clean your tick marks or do not use them at all!
content.protection: Clean fall.  Downclimb the pine tree, but be gentle!

content.description: East side of Bolt rock (sometimes called The Egg) left side of face up to large bowl. Look for knob. Some people may have to jump for it.

Blood Moon is the biggest link up of climbs in Groom Creek. Making for an instant classic power endurance problem. Blood Moon starts sitting in the cave of Moonlighting V8, do this route but instead of heading right and topping out, move out of the cave left and traverse the dirty rail into Full Moon V8. From here catch a shake and move into Moonstone V6/7 and finish as for moonstone. In total there are about 28-32 moves on this beast.  

  This rail is constantly dirty, for repeats of the line cleaning is mandatory to find the holds.
content.protection: 2-3 pads once you dial in the rail. The landing on the traverse is ugly and is ideally a no fall zone.
content.location: Start in the cave of Moonlighting do this route but exit left traverse into moonstone and finish moonstone.

pathTokens: Moonstone, Leg Lock Rock, Bolt Rock Area

content.description: Includes The Moonstone Boulder, Leg Lock Rock, Bolt Rock, and The Fish Boulder.
